text: The Korean ethnic group in China is an immigrant group which means people from North and South Korea stay there permanently. The size of the ethnic group is 2,489,076 (in year 2009). 1,830,929 are ethnic Koreans with Chinese citizenship (in 2010). The languages are Mandarin, Cantonese and Korean. == References == Category:Ethnic groups in China Category:History of China Category:History of Korea
title: Koreans in China
